title: Unhelful
body: My daughter had a appointment about her foot six months ago when seeing doctor he said about a bunion which was not the case turned out someone else notes were in her file next visit which was a month ago he did not know why we were there because there was no notes from previous visit the dr was very apologetic but it was not his fault think admi needs a shake up in some circumstances this could have been disastrous lucky it turned out okay hope this does not happen on the operation theatres

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Cannot wait to leave this practice
body: The midwifery services from this practice that we initially encountered were satisfactory, but this practice has been substandard in every other way since. Staff have been misinforming, rude, unhelpful and my family have never encountered being registered to a worse surgery

title: Always helpful & friendly practice
body:
I always find the staff and doctors to be helpful, accommodating & friendly. 
It’s easy to ring through for an appointment & you receive one in good time & don’t have to wait ages like other practices. 
The willow tree also recently helped me with a prescription error and I was very grateful. 
Overall a friendly local practice which I would recommend!

title: Quick progress, lovely staff
body:
I went and visited the dermatologist regarding my psoriasis, the doctor was so understanding and has quickly referred me. 
I have visited the path lab for bloods and waited for a chest x Ray today and was in and out in less than 45 minutes. Great service

readBy.name: George Eliot Hospital NHS Trust

title: Best experience of a practice.
body:
Joined this practice when moved to the area over 4 years ago. Immediately noticed all reception staff used first names, were friendly in manner and most helpful in ensuring appropriate appointments were achieved. 
Appointments with the two practice nurses reaffirmed these initial perceptions of the practice with both presenting a friendly and personal approach whilst dealing with the clinical matters.  One did not linger but at the same time not left with that feeling of being shown the door.  Having given injections it was a pleasure when on the receiving end of these to have them administered competently, meaning accurately, painlessly and in alternating sites.  Thank you both.
Doctors seen have appeared to possess an appreciation of the impact an ailment has on one.  Perhaps the best example to describe this would be the doctor following up by phoning our home to check on progress and any further concerns following an incident earlier in the week. Never known this elsewhere.
This practice seems to have an awareness of how to treat the person as well as the illness and injury making both just a little less traumatic.  
It is, therefore, a shame that, like so many practices, it is having to combine with others in the obligatory modern block as inevitably qualities described above will suffer with ever increasing patient numbers. It’s also suspected that a further valued quality will be diluted, that of continuity in getting the same doctor and nurse.
However, thank you to all mentioned as we are unfortunately leaving your catchment area.  Will hope for same elsewhere.

title: Top professionals
body: Following ankle replacement surgery I was referred to the physiotherapy team at Bensham hospital.I was given 1 to 1 and group therapy sessions,my treatment was given in a professional and courteous manner.I can not speak too highly of the staff involved and the treatment I received,and the improvement in my recovery was without doubt due to their expertise. Regards Terry Watson

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: A practice with extraordinary professionalism
body:
I have been over 8 years registered as a patient with this practice and I can wholeheartedly say that this is a merely perfect medical practice, nothing less. I have many health conditions and diagnoses.  The staffs here are excellent people. At times, you may struggle a little bit in getting your queries resolved rapidly or easily whilst making telephone calls to the reception compared to face-to-face contact, however that cannot be taken negatively given what an excellent patient service that they provide. The staff especially doctors know vulnerable people and will do their best to help you out. Always, they have been supportive of me. Doctors everywhere are nice people, but at this surgery, one could easily find angels, I know one. They go beyond professionalism. 

After reading many of the reviews left behind for this surgery,  the majority are positive and there is a reason for it. The doctors at this place are friendly and so are the nurses and receptionists. I am struggling to find the right words to express my gratitude but no words can do them any justice.

title: Caring and supportive practice
body: My Dad was in for rehabilitation, he received excellent care. He was happy with the environment, food, care, staff and support.

title: Barrier to seeking consultant review
body:
I have a tear in my meniscus, arthritis and medial ligament damage. My GP referred me to Ascenti (prior to knowing my MRI results)
The Physio team offered exercises I could have found on the internet and 30 min physio appointments 6 weeks apart.
To make matters worse when I asked the physio if she could prescribe exercise at a local gym she told me she was "insulted".The Physio clearly had no idea this option was available on the NHS and chose to take offence. Unprofessional, ill informed and frankly bizarre.
Therefore I have booked a private appointment with a consultant to review my current treatment plan.Its all very sad really as I have national insurance contributions totalling 49 years and I actually work in the NHS.
This service has been commissioned so your local CCG can tick boxes and meet targets by you receiving "treatment" within the target period.
The CCG should answer to the public for their inept management of local services.

title: Don’t call them if in crisis
body:
My advice is not to call Primary liaison team if you are in crisis. You will be treated badly and make your feeling of worthlessness worse, I had two contact with them, in the first one last summer,  I wasn’t aware who talked to me exactly, but  I knew later that it was a mental health nurse. The nurse was literally laughing at the way I overdosed, they even told me they had the joke with the hospital receptionist, the person wanted to get rid of me and leave. 
The second time, last week, I was again struggling, I have been given their number to call if in crisis, the nurse was very emotionless, patronising  and questioned why I called them, when I told them I overdosed, they said “what could I do for you?” 
If you call an ambulance for a cut in your finger, the person in the phone will never offend you and be rude to you, they just guide you to the needed care, but to have PCLS treat people who are mentally vulnerable in such a way is very damaging.  
Simply, admit your role exactly, tell health care professionals not to refer to you, 
I have absolutely no problem in not receiving support, and I rather be left alone than having someone injuring my dignity and my already fragile coping. 
Leave mental health patients alone and stay away
Saying that not all of them, I have seen some dealing with my friend in a very kind way,  My guess that That person was a newly graduate or a trainee who didn’t lose her humanity yet

title: new project
body: I started seeing a psychiatrist at the doctors surgery last year. Roughly half hour appointments and I could see them any time that I needed to within reason. For a change it felt much more of a community experience. It was easier to talk in a place where everyone goes, so much so that I was still learning to get used to it - when unfortunately, it ended. As I understand it, it was a new project that was for one year. Please come back. I think the project has got great potential and I found myself wanting to put the work in too. I haven't given up though. For the first time I have started to go out to look for help for my family - by myself. But most clients will know that its not easy to do or even know how to do on your own.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Gp
body:
I have a chronic illness and I have found an excellent GP within the practice.  Kind, caring,  non judgmental and goes out of their way to help. 
Only problem with this practice is trying to get through on the phone is a total nightmare at any time of day.   Be prepared to wait a LONG time for an answer!

title: Amazing care
body: From start to finish (original appointment to surgery. All staff have been amazing and I have felt safe and looked after. For all the stress the NHS is under the WHH did not show it. Thankyou

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: Brought grandson in to get advice on his conjunctivitis and in and out under an hour having been seen all the way through by good people.

title: Unhelpful
body:
I do not gel with my care coordinator,  nice person,  but do not find the relationship therapeutic.  Nothing I can do about it.
Staff are nice enough,  but often inaccurate phone messages are passed on.

readBy.name: NHS Leeds ICB

title: Fantastic experience
body: From start but being picked up by ambulance dropped off, team waiting at urology, seen to straight away. What a lovely friendly team of people including the ambulance men. Won’t worry so much when taking hubby for another appointment. Well done everyone involved in sorting my hubby out on Thursday.

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Not just GP
body: Once again I wanna say thank you to my GP . She is not just a doctor she is lovely person and help me a lots. For over year now I have back problem , pain in low back is bad and with out pain killers I wouldn’t be able do basic thinks. On the top of that I have other issues which come out of the blue . I visited my GP on Friday 14 of feb , very late appointment and she stop me from worrying so much. The way she talk and explain everything is just incredible. Member of my family is a experienced practicing cardio surgery and she never even can talk like my GP . Every time I see my doctor I feel better in my head . I wish all doctor are like she not just a job . Thanks Doctor

title: Looked after brilliantly
body:
I cannot praise you all enough.
 In the many years I have been a patient they have always listen, they ask what I think and give me complete confidence in their help.  So very lucky I am thank you so much.

title: Excellent prompt treatment
body: I was referred to A and E by my doctor, the whole experience from being seen by a triage nurse, blood tests and thorough detailed examination by a GP was all done within 2.5 hours. The only fly in the ointment was the screen you have to enter your details on.If you make a mistake it takes you back to the beginning, instead of just to the previous page , it took me 3 attempts to complete!

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Friendly and helpful staff
body:
I had reservations about changing my GP practice as I was very happy with the doctor's at the previous surgery. 
The staff at Randolph surgery are so welcoming, helpful and really friendly, I can't praise them enough for doing a great job!

title: Competent staff, great care
body: Kind and very knowledgable nurse and medical staff. Friendly receptionists, who are always busy answering phones and concerns, but treat people with care and attention. Work well all together, definitely better under new management.

title: Very caring, knowlegeable and efficient
body: Ward F7 took great care of my father with dementia, particularly the ward sister., we both thank you very much.

title: Elderly care
body: Accompanied 93 year old morher who has dementia and had suffered head injury due to fall. Most of nursing staff in A&E very professional, caring and approachable. Doctor condescending, flippant and sarcastic - could use some training in people skills imo.  Didn't seem to understand the nature of dementia and how frightened/confused my mum was. Hopefully we won't encounter this particular doctor again!

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointing
body: I've been with the practice for about 3 years now and honestly each time I go there i'm left feeling disappointed. I don't feel like i'm being listened to properly, I always feel rushed. The doctors are not engaging at all, it's so hard to get a reaction from him. He does not offer suggestion or offer advise. I find it very unprofessional and always leave feeling upset to that point where I wanted to make a complaint. I do find the receptionist helpful.

title: Nice new practice
body: I was very impressed on my first visit. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. My only criticism was the choice of radio channel which seemed to play rap music, not very relaxing. Maybe more soothing, classical music as background music?

title: First class hospital
body: This review is specifically on the Ophthalmology Department but, in fact, refers to my experience with every other department I have been referred to.  My clinical care has been first class and the attitude of all the staff I have come into contact with has been professional and compassionate at all times.  I have hospital experience in another area to compare my clinical care with and my husband and I constantly thank our lucky stars we have moved to Liverpool and for the outstanding care we have received from Aintree.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reactive
body:
With all doctors surgeries it can be difficult to get an appointment. However, I have a toddler and she was complaining that her ear was hurting, and explained the situation to the doctor and they were able to see my daughter within the hour. 
The overall experience was fast and my the nurse made my daughter feel at ease and relaxed.

author: tigeryp38
title: Immediately felt welcome
body: After two rather bad experiences with other surgeries I contacted Lawson Practice where I immediately felt welcome and well treated.   Both the lady I talked to on the phone and the lady working at the reception (Shumina) were friendly and in particular, really helpful.   Shumina resolved a quite important problem I had that the other surgeries I have been to could not in the same delay.   Thank you so much!

readBy.name: The Lawson Practice
City & Hackney GP Confederation

title: Caring people
body: I have found all staff , Doctors, pharmacist, nurses and receptionists very helpful and caring. It is an extremely busy practice but the staff always take time to sort out problems.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: Unacceptable
body:
My 2year old had been unwell since a week ago and we have been sent home before by A&e. Today he had been vomiting blood and fever still would not go and still had not been eating. We have waited for 7 hours and saw doctors sitting on the desks but was just calling people very slow.
Finally when we where seen, doctor said that vomiting blood is not normal but still sent us home saying if it happens again to come back. My two year old had been unwell for a week now and not swallowing.

Also the waiting area was very dirty with drinks spilt everywhere and floors where dirty and nothing was clean. The toilets also was not clean

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Doctors; Poor Practice Management
body:
My doctors are excellent. At the time of registration, I used to be perpetually exhausted. They have given timely care and appropriate treatment, advise and given me a new life I must add. Quality of life transformed immensely and I now look much younger and am healthier and fitter than most people of my age. I almost always get appointments for reviews, even doctors themselves advise me of a date for review.

However the practice management is poor. The patients council is a closed group. There is no information on this although we are told it is. If you enquire you would be directed to the practice manager who keeps it closed to a selected few. There are no feedback forms, instead just a box. Overall non-medical input is very poor, perhaps they don't quite represent the demographic of the catchment area they serve.

I however have not faced any appointment  or telephonic assistance waiting issues. Those at the reception appear to be excellent and obliging. I would rate the staff are good overall, doctors excellent but the management need to welcome service users of all backgrounds to be pro-actively involved in service provisions. The environment seems to be too controlling and so clients are not heard, it would seem. For this reason I have noticed that the surgery is stagnant and slightly dated in terms of service provisions. 

An excellent primary care would not only create a healthier and self-aware community but also save NHS immense resources.

title: Thank you...
body:
On Thursday 14.2.20 I attended Epsom hospital for biopsies to be taken as part of my assessment for prostate problems and I can say ‘Thank you’ to all concerned for the friendly and professional attitude... all very evident from the reception team right through to the surgical team.
In addition... a very special ‘Thank you’ to the post op team who took care of me when a blood clot developed after the op and a catheter was required....you can guess the rest...I really cannot praise the amazing nursing staff and doctor enough... Thank you so much again.

title: Long wait on phone
body: On several occasions have waited a long time for receptionist to answer phone, 20 mins, then thursday was 6 in the q and waited 27 mins, could  you tell me how you could remedy this,

title: Wonderfully efficient, thorough and re-assuring
body: Ambulance came to help mum (83 years) when she fell. Both paramedics were fantastic; efficient, thorough, re-assuring, not leaving until they were sure mum was ok to be left and she understood everything that was done and said, and they were sure she would see the doctor the next day. They were also generous with information about what they were doing and why, and I feel better equipped to manage should such a situation arrive in future. Love those guys...

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Bad experience
body: My husband was referred by Gp for nhs service provided by yourselves. I only mention nhs as the surgeon did! Our experience of him was that he was arrogant and dismissive of anyone’s opinions. He was not good at understanding patient issues and quick to pass on. A very negative experience which I hope was just a one off but our experience suggests this was not !

title: Exemplary Practice!
body:
Arrived at the Endoscopy unit on Friday. I was extremely anxious as the procedure I was about to have had failed two weeks earlier in another unit. From the moment I entered the unit I was put at ease. From the reception staff to the admin nurse I was kept fully informed of what was to take place in a calm and reassuring manner. 
Once into the area where the procedure was to take place I couldn’t have been with a more efficient and supportive team. They were amazing! Creating a calm yet informative atmosphere. Reassuring with explanations of what was to take place. 
When the procedure was completed the after care was great too. Gentle conversations of what would happen next. It was evident that the nursing team worked closely together and this had a wonderful effect on patient care and well being. So important. 
After a welcome cup of tea and a sandwich I was able to rest. 
Then followed the report given fully with sensitivity and recognition of what had taken place and the next steps. 
I cannot thank the staff enough. Well done everyone in the Endoscopy unit! You are fantastic.

title: Great medical care - poor reception team
body:
Reception team lack basic medical training. Not confident in answering simple questions or going the extra mile to problem solve.
Generally unfriendly and unprofessional. 
Doctors, nurses and midwives are excellent however receptionists unfortunately let the whole practice down.

title: Wonderful Care
body:
I have been attending the renal unit for the last two years and finally a week ago I had an elective kidney transplant from a family member.
I have only praise for the treatment and care I have received during this period, my appointments were always punctual and the care I have received pre and post op has been exemplary, all staff members from consultants to nurses to porters have been professional, caring and concerned for my health and welfare
I cannot thank you enough for giving my family and myself a life back.
I would also like to thank a doctor from Russell Hall's Renal unit for recommending Coventry Hospital.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Be prepared for a long wait
body:
If you visit this practice be prepared for a long wait to see the receptionists if in the surgery.
If ringing hope you've got no plans for your day, you'll be on hold (if you can get through) for ages and ages. 
Appointments are gone within minutes of being open at 0830. 
Prescriptions are only available to order if you either call into the practice or have Internet access. Not very good for the older generation who may not have Internet.

title: Worst clinic I have ever been in London
body: Arrived with major symphtoms nearly 3 hours before closing, Saturday 12.15 pm. Filled the form and immediately after it I was told there is no slots left. Why they call it walk in clinic if patient arrives 3 hours before closing and receptionist refuses to put you in the queue. Just wasted my energy time and money for travelling and Im left with anxiety and no help. I will escalate this further. Close the clinic why you advertising its open on saturday when at the end you show the door to people who arrive all the way because they seek treatment. Horrible experience

title: Amazing staff
body:
This is a review for the sisters on ward 14.
What lovely women they were and helped me when I was admitted onto the ward. 
All of the staff on ward 14 are lovely, but they were fabulous. Helped me when I needed them and nothing seemed to be any bother for them.....
They need a massive thankyou from the NHS for being wonderful to everybody on the ward. 
Thankyou ladies
Stacey Craft-O'Connor

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic CBT services
body: Roughly two years ago I attended an extended CBT counselling service. I received an excellent quality of service from the therapist and have felt the effects of this even now. It has had a tremendous impact on my life in both the short and long term and I'm tremendously grateful to my therapist's patience in taking me through this and giving me tools to continue after our sessions had finished.

title: Fsmily involved
body: My daughter was in here. It was very good.  staff communicate with patients  and make sure information is correctly put down. They discharged my daughter once she was well enough. Treates family good.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Conscious sedation
body: I was absolutely terrified of having the termination under conscious sedation but can’t believe how quick and pain free it was. Every single nurse that I saw were so lovely and caring. they treated each individual to they’re needs and not just how they’ve been taught. I was treated with the utmost dignity and care during the whole process. I was home in less than 2 hours and the actual procedure only took 3 minutes of which I remember nothing apart from the lovely nurse who talked to me throughout to keep my mind off of everything. Just want to thank each and every one of the bpas staff from the initial phone call right through to when I went home your all amazing and I’ll be forever grateful for your support and care.

title: NHS at it’s best
body:
My husband had orthopaedic surgery at Frimley Park last week. The whole experience was excellent. Efficient, friendly nursing care, good ancillary staff.
Good explanation of post op care on discharge. Would highly recommend.
Just wish car parking and charges were better!

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great facility and service
body:
I have lived in Rossendale a few years and been referred to the hub by my GP for two different services, Physio and Podiatry, the referrals being a year or two apart. Both services have been great, and as I leave poor reviews when I'm not happy, it's only right that I should leave a good one now, when I'm very content with the service received. I got an appointment for podiatry within 36 hours of being referred by my GP - they telephoned me to offer it! I was told I could follow up my initial visit (should I need to) by just coming in on any Thursday within 6 months of my initial appointment and waiting to be seen. I did that this week and only waited 5 minutes to be seen. Physio understandably had a slightly longer initial waiting list/time but it wasn't unreasonable. All in all I'm very pleased. Thank goodness for our NHS. We're very lucky. To sum up my experience in bullet points:-

- quick initial referral to services - no excessive waiting and worrying
- easy to make convenient subsequent appointments
- walk in service available (for those referred initially by their GP)
- good advice given at the counter and over phone by admin staff
- all admin and clinical staff very friendly, polite and professional
- all work/services performed to a high standard
- good advice given by clinicians 
- convenient location and opening hours

Thanks to all staff involved!

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent example of a good practice
body:
I've moved a lot and been registered by many practices and this is by far the best. There are several options for booking an appointment so you can choose the one that suits you. The practice prioritises appointments well to ensure that slots aren't wasted.
The practice is very welcoming the waiting room has a very community feel.
All the doctor's and nurses I've met at the practice have made me feel extremely comfortable and this has really benefited my health as I can ask questions without being judged.
Really couldn't be better and this centre should act as a good practice guide.

title: Great Service
body:
We are all quick to complain about the NHS but slow to praise when you do get a good level of service.

I totally understand people’s frustration at having to wait 4-5 weeks for an appointment at Sparcells which angers people, but I have to say the lady doctor that I have seen recently has been the best doctor I have seen in 20 years at being at Sparcells practice.

You really do feel that she ‘cares’ about her patients, she listens, understands your health concerns and is positive in her approach. Most important have never once thought she was in a hurry to get me out the door, which is what happens too often nowadays.

The reception staff are always helpful and polite to me too and do what they say they will do. It is not their fault they cannot fit you in as quick as you would like all the time.

Thank you Sparcells surgery and a special thank you to the Doctor.

title: Please take back problems more seriously
body:
My husband attended a and e two days ago in an ambulance as he could barely walk. The first attempt at getting him there was futile. Ambulance crew took him to a pharmacy.
Second attempt.. we arrived. A and E was empty of patients apparently due to coronavirus scare, however medical professionals retained the manner of bring rushed off of their feet with hardly any time to spare. There were maximum 6 patients kn A+E
The consultant examined my husbands back while my husband sat in a wheelchair fully clothed. 
I requested an mri scan and the consultant seemed truly amazed that i would have the audacity to ask for such a thing. Two days later and my husband has deteriorated. He cannot walk at all and is unable to move from the bed. I would appreciate a reply to this as I am at a loss as to know what to do.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Disappointing service
body: It was unfortunate that when I arrived for my appointment I was informed that they had made a mistake in the booking where instead of being booked for a doctor they had booked me in to see the Nurse. They were trying to be positive and offered another appointment for much later in the day which was inconvenient. The mistake should have been picked up sooner and I should have been contacted earlier in the week or that morning. I would have appreciated an instant apology and an offer of an appointment within the hour which I would have been happy with.

title: Getting a quick apointment
body: I was suprised to get such a quick appointment for a none urgent request. Called in Friday expecting to have to wait a couple of weeks to be told I could see a doctor the following day Saturday morning :0)

author: jagw
title: your email address doesn't work
body: delivery has failed is the message you get when you email the address on this website.

readBy.name: Spring Hill Practice
City & Hackney GP Confederation

title: Put You at Ease
body:
I was a little reluctant about having the Bowel Scope Screening, imagining it to be very embarrassing.
However, the staff realise this and put you at ease from the start, describing what will happen and what to expect.
For anyone that can't decide whether to have it done, or not, I'd say go for it. As they say, 'Don't die of embarrassment '.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exemplary care by a fantastic front line team
body:
I got taken into the Acute Medical Assessment ward by ambulance for a heart problem. I spent one night in that ward and then got sent to the Cardiac Care unit for one night. In both cases I was given an exemplary level of professional and very effective health care from every Dr, Nurse, HCA and ancillary staff member in spite of the fact they were rammed full of poorly people, some sadly much worse than myself. They are a super front line team of truly dedicated people who work seamlessly with each other. The hospital wards I experienced were very clean and tidy and kept that way all day. The hospital food was very good as hospital food goes, food was fresh and appetising and served with a smile
All organisations can do better with adequate funding but Shrewsbury Royal are doing a fabulous job with what they have got. I just hope the government’s promises are not in fact falsehoods

Thank you so very much for looking after me so well Shrewsbury Royal Team🏅🏅🏅🏅🏅

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: First class care
body: From the moment of being seen in triage to assess my illness to ending up on the respiratory ward ( Culm East ) with pneumonia, I have nothing but praise in how I was treated by all the staff, bearing in mind the pressures they are all under at the moment in the NHS. Nothing is too much trouble for these special caring people who put your mind at ease at a time when you can’t process what is going on with your body. The thoughtfulness of all the staff definitely aids your recovery, many thanks to everyone involved in my care.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Fantastic staff
body: Blue lit to A & E, with difficulty breathing 31/12/20 - I cannot emphasise enough how grateful I am to all the staff there who were so attentive and responsive - I have to say I was really surprised how organised and caring they all were esp the Nurse  and two lovely lady doctors - treatment and diagnosis with X-ray was really swift (X-rayed within around half hour)  - was such a traumatic experience, which was alleviated considerably by the professionalism and treatment there; I also transferred to a ward for a night (not sure where), where all the nurses were also so kind and helpful - Thank you all so very very very much .... I appear to be quickly recovering really well, which is definitely as a result of the prompt treatment I received 👍🏼🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Great practice
body: My family and I have been using this GP Surgery for over 20years. Our experiences from the receptionist to the doctors have been friendly and professional. They have moved location over the years and have had different receptionists, but the standard of service has remained exceptional. Although I sometimes have to wait over 2weeks to see my doctor, this is not uncommon across London in busy practices and therefore I won't mark them down on that. Overall, support staff and doctors in this surgery are very helpful and professional and I'll highly recommend them to anyone looking for professional care. JO

title: Very helpful staff
body:
I needed an emergency appointment and went to the GP surgery straight to make it. Receptionist was extremely helpful. She understood my situation. Although they were tight with the appointments, she spoke to the practice manager and got me an appointment to see the doctor. 
I gave a referral form to her that the doctor asked me to give on the way out. In the same week, I had an appointment with the referred specialty. 
I have been a patient in this surgery for several years now and I wish to say that the receptionist should be an example to some of the other receptionists in the surgery. She is very polite, understanding, friendly and helpful to the patients.

title: Poor telephone system
body:
I have no problems with any staff (usually very polite and helpful) just the way the surgery runs the telephones/reception. They have two people on the front desk who have to deal with the phones and people coming in. This is ok in a one or even two dr practice. But in such a large medical centre does not work. This is what infuriates your patients and where most of your complaints come from. Patients get angry for being on hold for so long and then feel they can’t get what they want/need from you and believe it’s because the staff are rude. When really it’s because of how long they have been waiting. You should have 2 dedicated staff on the phones and one on the front. Then this can be swapped throughout the day so staff do a variety of work. This means the calls would not be on hold for so long. Sometimes even a hour. Which is just ridiculous. You are expanding so really should think about changing the way reception is run. Rather than taking on even more patients (just because you get paid for the amount of people you have registered) when the ones you already have can’t even get through to the practice! 
This has been a problem for so long but has just got worse recently. This must really affect your staff morale as well. Please think of the patients you already have and how you can ease tension between them and your poor staff!!

title: Life threatening waiting times
body: My terminally ill parent called to make an appointment to see the GP after he was released from hospital to review his medication and explained he was physically unable to go to the practice, so either needed a home visit or phone consultation   They were told the earliest they could do was a 2 week wait for a phone call.  I cannot believe that assessing the medication of a terminally ill person is not a priority and this is shocking.  What are they supposed to do to get their medication reviewed in a reasonable timeframe?

title: Fantastic staff
body: Went for a Endoscopy for my stomach and received such great service from the busy team there. They were so polite and put you at ease and very impressed with how they triple checked my date of birth and name and more. The doctor was so nice and caring.

title: Amazing service
body: Stayed on Jasmine Ward in the women's unit after having my appendix out, amazing girls, I felt really looked after, nothing was too much trouble. Well done ladies. The staff on SAU where I first was were also amazing, especially a nice student nurse. Very polite young man.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

title: Inadequate Availability
body: Having been referred in early October 2019, and had an appointment for November cancelled at very short notice, I finally received an appointment for Sunday 23 February. Contrary to expectations, the appointment was to take place at a Health Centre in a rough area of Birmingham. As I am in my mid-sixties and unsteady on my feet, I was not prepared to attend at this place and phoned for an alternative, preferably at the hospital site. I was then told, the first available appointment would be 'towards the end of March' - meaning I would be lucky to be seen within six months of the original referral. I have, therefore, withdrawn from this referral and will go back to my GP to discuss other options. My advice to anyone looking to book an appointment at Birmingham Skin Centre is don't even try - a complete waste of my own, and my GP's time.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent Experience
body: I recently had an MRI on my neck,  but also had one on my head in October 2019. On both occasions the staff were wonderful and calmed my nerves! All staff took trouble to explain exactly what would happen and treated me with courtesy and respect. I felt like hugging them! Thank you all so much. And thank heavens for our wonderful NHS.

readBy.name: Plymouth University MNurs Nursing 2019-09
Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Very efficient and smooth running department.
body:
When i had my cataract operation i found the staff friendly and helpful the whole process was very efficient and smooth running.
Thanks Chris.

title: Very greatful
body:
I Would like to thank the surgeons, theatre staff and all working staff of ward 28 for my care pre, during and after my hip operation. You are all wonderful. So caring and professional. 
The only negative I had of my experience is that I couldn’t sleep for the noise on an evening, which wasn’t totally the staffs fault. They have a job to do.
I hope I was a respectable patient in your eyes. I know how hard it can be to care for someone who is grumpy because they are in pain.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous Nurse
body: I had a blood test on Friday right at the end of the day, I missed my appointment time due to the traffic and the Nurse kindly said she would still see me even though it was clear they were closing! She was fantastic and so friendly, and definitely very good at her job. She even took the time to make me smile and sort out another problem I have - thank you so much! I will definitely see her again if I ever need a blood test, fantastic service.

title: Excellent care
body:
I was referred to the Opthalmology Department by my optician at the end of last year and was operated on for cataracts in my left eye on the 14th of February. Although this is the most common operation performed in hospitals throughout the world I was nervous beforehand.

There was absolutely no need. From the moment of arrival I was made welcome and was taken through all the pre-op procedures by attentive and caring staff who made me feel I would be in safe hands.

When I was collected by the theatre staff the procedure was carefully described and any query was answered. The theatre sister / senior nurse was very reassuring before, during, and after the surgery. The surgeon was calm and reassuring throughout and I came out of theatre with no worries about having the same surgery on my right eye.

This has been my experience in the other three departments I have attended. The Lung Function at the Royal, Cardiology and ENT at Castle Hill. All staff caring, courteous, and helpful.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Gastroscopy was a piece of cake.
body:
On Thursday 13th February I attended the Gastroscopy department (within the treatment centre) I had attended alone as my husband had been called into work. I was a little  anxious as I was to have a procedure that was new to me. 
From the minute I attended at the reception to the minute I left I was treated with the utmost care & respect I have ever had within a NHS facility, he whole atmosphere was calm & relaxed, which put me at ease. All the staff I had encountered were very professional, caring, informative, gentle and very reassuring. My procedure was performed with the utmost skill of the nurse and her staff and I had no pain or discomfort afterwards.
My husband was unable to collect me as I’d had sedation and I wasn’t allowed to leave alone, a nurse kindly escorted me out of the department to find and meet my neighbour who had come to collect me.
Honestly I cannot praise the department and all the staff more highly and take pleasure in writing this note. Please pass on my comments to everyone in the department because the staff were truly amazing.
Very kind Regards 
Bev Flagg.

title: Superb treatment
body:
On Wednesday the 12th February I visited the Orthodontist with my Grandson.  We were Treated with such Efficiency and Empathy for a very nervous Grandson.
Sincere Appreciation to all concerned.

readBy.name: Oxford University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Keyhole surgery
body: I spent the day in Maple ward last Tuesday,and would like to thank all the staff from the moment I walked in to the moment I walked out, I was welcomed to the ward and put at ease as I was very nervous. Everything about my procedure was explained to me and I was taken to theatre by my lovely consultant who introduced me to theatre staff. After my op I woke up in recovery by 4 lovely ladies and then taken back to the ward, I couldn’t wish for any better treatment and just want to sa a very big Thankyou to everyone concerned xx

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous service
body: The service Mastercall provide is second to none.  From filling out the 111 form online to promptly receiving a call from an Advanced Nurse Practitioner, being offered a triage slot at the centre then being seen by an excellent Clinician.  The system was faultless and feeling unwell it made things so much easier to deal with.  Thank you to all at Mastercall for looking after me today and the wonderful service you provide to us very lucky patients x

title: No problems
body: Seen within an hour after phoning given very good advice ,seen nurse and doctor and seen again following day . Been at Horsefair for 45 years and all family looked after well, thank you

title: Very busy department
body:
Referred to ophthalmology by my optician in December 2019, as she thought I had a possible retinal problem. Appointment  6 weeks later at Eye Hospital. Extremely busy with only one receptionist, no privacy at the desk as the waiting area was pretty full. Nurse instilled eye drops to dilate my pupils, warned this may make me sensitive to light, but whole department is well lit, so unless you’ve brought sunglasses it’s difficult to avoid light. Eyes photographed then waited to see consultant, who spent about 2 minutes telling me no abnormalities. Whole process took 2 hours and cost over £4 to park.
Although I received very good news, I felt that this department is chaotic with an expensive car park, and rarely saw a smiling face on the staff/team faces.
Hopefully never have to return.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: The online appointment booking system is a joke.  The only appointments available are for Asthma review or smear test.  Phoning the practice always results in being told to go to the hub.  If you get offered a phone appointment the GP tells you they cannot help because they do not know you - they will never know me if they always tell me to go to the hub.

title: The most helpful staff
body:
The reception staff at The Clinic are the most helpful and friendly staff I have come across in the NHS. They are very polite and helpful when I have needed an appointment and a number of times I have needed other assistance and they have made me feel like nothing is too much trouble. I was very thankful when they rang me because a supermarket contacted them to ask them if they could inform me that I had left my purse at the supermarket! They really go above and beyond. 

The practice nurses are equally helpful and friendly and I have generally had good experiences with the Drs too. There are two waiting areas so it never gets too crowded and it’s easy to avoid sitting next to other coughing patients. I would highly recommend this practice.

title: Great care, support and expertise
body:
I attended A&E on the recommendation of the out of hours Badger service. On arrival the ambulance area looked overflowing as was reception. I was quickly and efficiently taken through to the 'majors hub' with my wife. Even though I was feeling very unwell, with a blinding headache, light sensitivity and dry retching following an extended period of vomiting, it seemed every available space was taken by trolleys with patients. at 6.00-6.30pm it was not what I would have thought to be a busy time for A&E. Considering how busy it was I was seen incredibly quickly. This is not the place to give an account listing my treatment. The fact it included a CT scan, an overnight stay on ACU, assurance by overworked staff that we had done exactly the right thing in using their service even though the final diagnosis of 'food poisoning' was not as bad as they had feared is what is relevant. 
Following my treatment I have nothing but respect and admiration for every member of the team I came in contact with throughout my stay. In the early hours of Friday morning when I was beginning to feel a little more human myself, I became even more aware of the skills of nursing and medical staff working 12.5 hour night shifts. Diagnosing, treating, patiently explaining and supporting patients and family members. The response was as varied as the range of ailments being treated. If the staff had employed any less skill or patience I am sure the atmosphere could have been far more hostile.
At 66 I am fortunate that I do not have to avail myself of many of the NHS services. Although I do seem to have made more demands in the last 5 years. I do not consider my self a very politically active member of the community but I do like to give praise where it is due. I could not have asked more from the NHS than that which was given to me at Good Hope hospital. As a country I hope that the recent political interest and promises to the NHS are held to account. Equally that essential related issues such as Adult Social care services are tackled promptly and in a unified manner. Not, as in the past, delayed because they are too difficult to handle. The pressure  this failure was putting on Good Hope A&E team, throughout that Thursday night early Friday morning, could not have been more obvious. Yes, it will need to be paid for. Let us hope the time is right for these issues to be tackled!
My thanks to Good Hope staff

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good patient care
body: I attended for a procedure. The Dr was very attentive and thoughtful. He explained what he planned to do, and carried out the procedure efficiently. I felt no discomfort. His technique was very clean which reassured me.

title: Overall great
body: I am deeply thankful to all clinical and non clinical staff. I have found the service very responsive  on numerous occasions. I can access a phone consultation the same day or 1-2 days later, and has been my experience i can book a nurse or GP within the/a week. The service provided has been really good, with the exception of one GP who admitted they did not know much about my presentation, but was unfortunate they did not also know the practice had specialist nurses who did know, wasting some time. Apart from that experience everyone has been very professional and supportive. A big thank you!!

title: 5 star hospital
body: Just had my left hip replacement done here would highly recommend, all the staff from the receptionists, ward staff,theatre staff down to the cleaner's couldn't do enough for you. The cleanliness of the ward's where outstanding and the food excellent

title: Caridac Centre - Great practice
body: I had by ICD box changed after having it for almost 10 years. Everything went good. During the whole stay I was helped and fully informed by friendly personel and doctors. Now after two weeks I feel fully recovered and would like to say how thankful I am.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Best possible experience
body: The team at GWH we’re amazing throughout the process of having my first surgery. I was incredibly nervous and the whole team from the Surgeons, Anaesthetists and the after care nurses did everything possible to make me feel at ease. I was cared for very well and made to feel like I could ask for anything if I needed. A huge thank you to the Surgeons, Anaesthetists and the Nurses on the Daisy Unit.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: No problems with this Hospital,
body: I have been a frequent visitor to several clinics for the last  5 years and see first hand what the staff have to put up with and how busy they are, yes the waiting times at some clinics can be long, I have several long term illness and expect to be visiting for the foreseeable future and appreciate all the care I am receiving, I have also had 2 short stays in hospital this year and same again cannot fault the nursing staff on any of the wards I was on total respect for all of them. I am now on a home care plan to help me manage my illnesses and keep me out of the hospital, very pleased with all the care I have recieved at Barnsley Hospital.

readBy.name: Barnsley Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: great care
body: i got rushed in on the 10/02/2020 with a svt i cannot fault any of the staff they were great kept me calm,and made sure i was ok every min.we are so easy to put bad stuff up and moaning,but i cannot thank you all enough and b18 ward i was on,my heart doctor 10/10 and once again thankyou

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Promise the earth but never deliver
body: Was promised they were now actually helping. Go speak to them get told am priority yet nothing since. I only went there as severely desperate, they promise they will help then deliver nothing. Been ringing them and drs daily! Still nothing. If you want to get better do it yourself as these are no help at all

readBy.name: Cornwall Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good surgery
body: Having used the self check in facility I asked a receptionist if I could make an appointment to see my GP. Directed to an iPad I filled out an econsult and requested my own gp. I then used the patient pod which took my statistics, and  later on received  a text message to say my econsult had been received and I would get a call back from my own gp which I did.

title: Not bothered to call
body:
Was told I would get a call back when I rang today 4.45pm 5 hours later nothing!!!!!!
Terrible service

title: Superb support
body: The doctor has been amazing and supportive as has most of the team during my visits and on going health issues highly recommend the practice .

readBy.name: Millway Medical Practice

title: Disappointed
body: Went for an ECG. Disturbed on arrival not only by the lack of parking but by the subtle branding seen everywhere by Virgin. Is this the beginning of the end for the NHS? I was called on time, had to be taken through wards as there was construction work taking place, but wondered whether that was good practice considering the dangers of infection. In the room two practitioners , one a Virgin employee who basically ignored me. The other who was using the equipment very quickly suggested that the equipment was not the best, and recommended a second visit to the RHU. Despite being told that the result would be explained to me, in the leaflet telling how the process would work, this did not happen. I was then shown out of the room to negotiated the building work without proper directions. A few days later I got the results from my own doctor who concurred with getting a second screening done. Felt like a waste of my time, the Virgin person seemed utterly redundant, and seemed to contribute nothing to the process. Presumably by care was billed to the NHS. I wouldn’t fly Virgin so would have liked to know that this facility, whose parent company is based of shore, and presumably profiting that company rather than as is hoped for within the NHS, being free at every level, paid for through mine and others taxes. If this is the future I despair. A second NHS cardiogram in an NHS hospital as this one wasn’t good enough. Perhaps thats because cardiology wasn’t on the tick list , which it should be if you provide these services, so I had to tick don’t know to continue. That sums up the situation really. If it’s offered in your care options ask if you can make a different choice.

title: Not possible to comment
body: I self refered last year summer of 2019, and still haven’t heard anything back from them, I’ve tried calling numerous times, but haven’t been able to get through to anyone, I’m not sure how long the wait is for someone to get back to me?

readBy.name: West London NHS Trust

title: Wonderful care
body: My 95 year old father was a patient at the Frimley Park Hospital in Dec/Jan and my sister and I made the trip from Canada to be with him.  I can't tell you how impressed I was with the care that was given to my father during his stay and how much we appreciated everything that was done for him.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful and compassionate and I will be forever grateful that he had the best care possible.  The care and cleanliness of this hospital was absolutely first class and we couldn't have asked for anything better.  My father passed away while in the hospital but I am happy to say that my sister and I were able to be with him right up until he passed.  I can't praise your hospital enough for everything you did while he was in your care....thank you all for making his final days as comfortable as you did.

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful Place
body: I went there today to have stitches removed  from a biopsy at the Royal Free. I was passed around from pillar to post. When I was  seen one & a half hours later I passed my letter to the nurse that the Royal Free had given me,she asked me What hospital sent you here? I proceeded to say it's on the letter which I had given her,she then went on to ask "what type of stitches are they? I mean how am I supposed to know that. Totally unprofessional. She then went on to remove my stitches without putting any gloves on. How utterly unhygienic, thought that would be a basic requirement. This is the most awful place I have ever visited.

title: Amazing staff
body: My son had emergency surgery for a possible testicular torsion . The theatre team where wonderful they took time to introduce themselves to me and talk to my son as he was about to undergo a GA. The nursing staff on the short stay children’s ward alike where amazing really kind and lovely. The Dr who performed the surgery was wonderful too she took time to speak to my son and I and was reassuring and informative .

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional ,Reassuring,Caring Staff
body: Arrived A&E by car. Seen immediately as pain so high. Given pain control and examinations by wonderful staff. Transferred to ward 15 All staff on the ward saw to my every need. Stayed with me when I was scared of the surgery . They were always so busy looking after very poorly people over every 24 hour period and I mean every member of staff on the ward. Loved the porters, their sense of humour made visits for scans and tests less daunting and just what I needed. I have no downside to this review, I needed emergency help and received it from professionals at every turn. Thank you Cramlington staff for how you helped  me through a difficult time, I had never had major surgery before. I also got an insight into the valuable NHS and how we must protect it and also value those who work within it. Last comment the meals were also excellent, well done to the catering service.

readBy.name: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional practice, highly recommended
body:
A big thanks to the young Dr that I saw on Thursday 13 of Feb . you have made me stress out. After her examination, She referred me same day to the hospital for further investigations. I am so pleased that I saw her as this has put my mind at rest.
I also wanted to thank you to a very helpful receptionists and to all the staff at this practice.

title: Repeat prescription conversation
body: Very negative & unhelpful telephone staff member - instruction from pharmacist to be issued with emergency medication they needed instruction from doctor - surgery admin would not escalate nor understand my requirement for DAILY medication & fact that I was already out of the prescribed medication & now at risk. My experience since Dragon Cottage changes is 100% negative with this surgery & frontline administration staff

title: Most wonderful home and care
body:
My mother was a resident for four years and was so well looked after by the staff who are amazing. They have become friends of the family and genuinely care. They are are warm and welcoming. They looked after my mother and gave her dignity.
If you are looking for a care home for a loved one you will not find a better home.

title: Great staff, rubbish phone system
body:
I already had an appointment for my son booked and after receiving a voicemail from the nurse, I needed to ring to clarify time. After trying to ring over several occasions the best waiting  time to speak to a receptionist was 56 minutes! It was quicker to finish work early and drive back to Lancaster and go into the surgery to check. 
Staff are always great when you can speak to them but the phone system lets the practice down.

title: Excellent
body:
Having been with this practice for 20 years and being a Health care professional, I can only praise the service offered. My children have always been given same day appointments for illnesses requiring swift attention. I’ve always had appointments within 48 hours if needed ( rarely).
The staff from receptionists to GPs are professional, empathetic and kind. 
The practice offer callbacks where face to face appointments aren’t needed. Working in an environment where I have daily contact with GPs and patients from across the West Midlands I can honestly say this practice is outstanding with its communication, prioritising urgent appointments especially for children, and its commitment to supporting those with long term conditions.
We all have to take some responsibility for our health - there are alternatives to seeing a GP face to face if appropriate - it’s worth considering using www.nhs.uk for accurate web health advice or NHS 111 where there are always GPs, Advanced Nurse Practitioners, Advanced Paramedics,  Pharmacists, Mental Health and Dental Nurses on duty 24 hours a day.
Thank you to all at this surgery

title: Very good GP
body: My doctor is very approachable, good listener, and good advice. She put me at ease, and I would definitely ask to see her again.
